etymologies: Old English wȳscan, of Germanic origin; related to German wünschen, also to ween and wont

notes.text: Is it correct to say I wish I were rich or I wish I was rich? On the question of the use of the subjunctive mood, see subjunctive

definitions: feel or express a strong desire or hope for something that is not easily attainable; want something that cannot or probably will not happen

examples.text: he wished that he had practiced the routines

shortDefinitions: feel or express strong desire or hope for something that is not easily attainable

definitions: silently invoke a hope or desire, especially in a ritualized way

examples.text: I closed my eyes and wished

shortDefinitions: silently invoke such hope or desire

definitions: feel or express a desire to do something
shortDefinitions: feel or express desire to do something

definitions: ask (someone) to do something or that (something) be done

examples.text: I wish it to be clearly understood

shortDefinitions: ask someone to do something or that something be done

definitions: express a desire for (the success or good fortune) of (someone)
shortDefinitions: express desire for success or good fortune of

definitions: hope that something unpleasant will happen to

examples.text: I would not wish it on the vilest soul

shortDefinitions: hope that something unpleasant will happen to

phrases.text: if wishes were horses, beggars would ride
the wish is father to the thought

notes.text: Is it correct to say I wish I were rich or I wish I was rich? On the question of the use of the subjunctive mood, see subjunctive

definitions: a desire or hope for something to happen

examples.text: the union has reiterated its wish for an agreement
it is their wish to continue organizing similar exhibitions

shortDefinitions: desire or hope for something to happen

definitions: an expression of a desire or hope for something to happen, typically in the form of a request or instruction

examples.text: she must carry out her late father's wishes

definitions: an invocation or recitation of a hope or desire
shortDefinitions: invocation or recitation of hope or desire

definitions: an expression of a desire for someone's success or good fortune

examples.text: they had received kindness and good wishes from total strangers

shortDefinitions: expression of hope for someone's success or welfare

definitions: a thing or event that is or has been desired; an object of desire

examples.text: the petitioners eventually got their wish

shortDefinitions: thing that is or has been wished for

phrases.text: if wishes were horses, beggars would ride
the wish is father to the thought
